review: Best Friday's experience yet.  Long wait at the door, but once at table accommodated  immediately even brought extra napkins before food showed.  Food was great service was excellent.  The bad thing as always with Friday's "music is so loud".  Other than that will return.

It was Saturday night and I was STARVING. I didn't really care where I was eating at that point. My boyfriend suggested TGI Friday's since we figured Texas Roadhouse would be a 2+ hour wait or something ridiculous like that. At TGI Fridays it was merely a 20 mins wait (maybe less actually). We were seated in a cozy booth and greeted by our server Denise. She was nice and friendly but a little too friendly/perky? While she was quite helpful with the menu and ordering and bringing us refills without asking, she wasn't always around when we actually needed her.  As for the food, we had the spinach artichoke flatbread, which was decent but it was less flatbread and more matzo-type cracker. For entrees, I tried the spicy beer cheese burger which was pretty good, but I got tired of it after the first half. My boyfriend had the caribbean rubbed ribs which were pretty good. For dessert we had the salted caramel cake.  Overall it hit the spot.

Quick speedy service. Food was your usual friday fare. They do have specials, unfortunately not late night...boo but oh well. Came here late at night was seated right away and we got our food almost immediately. Great service, our waitress was so nice.

Must have been one of my worst experiences at any restaurant. The hostess was extremely rude, did not greet me as I approached her through the entrance, continued talking to her coworker as I stood in front of her waiting for a number as there was a 30-35 minute wait for a table for 2. However, the hostess was completely polite and courteous to the couple just before me.  After being seated at our extremely filthy table (table surface, seating, and underneath were all soiled and crumby), we were greeted promptly by our waitress. We ordered and received our drinks and appetizers. Main entrée was served soon after; I had ordered the black angus cheeseburger. Ordered the burger medium, it was served fairly pink throughout, most definitely NOT medium, I could almost say it was barely cooked. When I pointed this out to the waitress, she insisted that I was wrong and that the burger was most definitely medium well. Completely irritated, she offered to take the burger away and quickly did so. She was short with us for the rest of our brief time there. I will never return to this location and do not recommend this Fridays location to anyone else unless you are looking for a disgusting table, rude workers, and raw entrées.

It's a typical TGIF. Though the staff here was nice and seemed to take care of my niece and she has a good time and it showed. Food is always pretty good and desserts were really nice and prepared nicely on each dish. The staff singing happy birthday to my niece was really nice too. It made her feel like it was her day. This is a nice place when you wanna surprise someone with a birthday with friends and family.
since i have nothing remotely good to write about this place,  i will write nothing at all!  buyer beware!  nuff said!

Typical of the genre.  It's one step up from Fast Food.  Restaurant experience was mediocre from beginning to end.  Staff were nice enough, but often found our server wandering off to chit chat with her co-worker friends.  Food did arrive fast, almost TOO fast, as if it was prepared ahead of time, which it probably was.  Everything tasted acceptable, except wife's veggies were stone cold and required replacement, or microwaving (who knows what they do when they take it back).  The big advantage of coming to this location is avoiding the large crowds at the Huntington or Westbury locations.  We got in and seated immediately.  I wish they didn't change the menu so many times.  I have to re-learn everything every time I come here.  It's probably one of the better TGIF's on Long Island.

I think TGI Friday's have really come a long way in recent years.  They really have elevated their menu to a level of quality I wouldn't expect from a chain.  I never like Applebee's or Chilis.  Everything seems fried or like bar food and has a certain taste that smacks of large chain. The absolute best item I've had here is the Jack Daniel's ribeye steak.  It is always tender, cooked just right and comes with an amazing, sweet and savory Jack Daniels glaze.  It is addictive.  I've eaten steaks at the best steakhouses, and although this is smaller and not quite the same experience, the meat is very high quality.  And the price is right for a quick, casual bite in the afternoon. The sides are surprisingly good too.  The parmesan fries are outstanding.  They are thick steak fries and come with a garlic sauce and nice shavings of cheese.  The vegetable medley has zucchini and yellow squash, my favorites.  I also like their wedge salad with chunky blue cheese and bacon crumble. My friend got a garlic shrimp dish and it was very good, but very heavy on fresh chunks of garlic so be prepared.  The nice new addition they've made is to serve our meal on cast iron skillets, so the food stayed hot throughout the meal.

Great waitress really nice and checked on us. Strong drink surprisingly (diddy up) not that big of a fan of the taste but it was strong. Food came out fast. We were in and in out and we didn't have to wait for a table, can't complain! 3 stars just because it's friday's food nothing special.
Horrible service ok food.

This Fridays location is going downhill. Hardly anyone in the restaurant,. Management is bad. It is hit or miss here during the week. Would you believe they did not have potato skins? My husband ordered  his second beer and after 10 minutes , the waitress comes to tell us they were "rounding up a glass"!!! I guess they only have one glass in the entire restaurant. It was not busy mind you , so it must have been true!! Our waitress must have apologized 20 times but after a while it was really pathetic. There is too much competion in the area with Miller Ale house, Hurricane Wings, Texas Roadhouse within 2 miles. Not worth the money even with a free meal reward, go somewhere else .  This is our 10th time here and I am sad to say our last time .  There are much better Fridays locations to go .

Eh such a shame I love Fridays. My waitress was very nice! However there were other things I did not like. Upon entering the restaurant my party and I smelled something really bad. Like not 'bathroom' bad, but almost like the smell of something extremely musty. Or honestly the spell of the extermination spray. Maybe they just got sprayed? However the restaurant had this horribly stale smell. Almost enough to make us want to leave. Stupidly we stayed.  We got to the table and I immediately took out the silverware from the incredibly wrinkled napkin ( I was hungry and ready to eat). I almost threw up when I saw my silverware was so dirty. It had these sticky smudges and gook all over it. Cmon really?  I am not a picky person but to have that nasty of silverware is unacceptable and it just shows the overall cleanliness of the store. Good thing we had a super nice waitress who took care of us right away! She was very pleasant!  Our food came to the table cold and not fresh at all. The food itself was nothing special and pretty lame. I could make better food myself at home with a few regular ingredients. It seriously was not worth the price. I should really be criticizing it more because it really was a joke. The two stars goes to there onion soup. I always get onion soup here, it is my favorite. Luckily that part of the meal was good!  It was just all rather disappointing. I go to Friday's restaurants in other areas a lot and I am usually always satisfied and love it there. This one must be going downhill.....

Fridays sucks in general, but this one sucks worse than usual. I got the Jack Daniels steak and shrimp and the steak was obliterated to the point of not being able to chew it and the shrimp was 1% meat  and 99% breading.

really no different from any other friday's in terms of food & drink, servers have always been friendly & never had a problem with waiting for a table here, definitely better organized than their massapequa outpost
Don't waste your money or time. Food is cold and nasty. Been here more than once thinking that the first time must of been a bad night but after tonite I realize that this place just sucks.

My parents came over from England and saw TGI Fridays they wanted to go because they have been to one in the uk and knew about the food.  It was totally different experience to England but in a good way. The Jack Daniels ribs are awesome. The food on a whole was excellent.  The server was Richie and he was amazing.  So knowledgable and entertaining. Great fun and made the whole trip an enjoyable experience.  Ask for Richie.

called to place an order on the phone. I. was transferred and no one ever answered. I tried again. was transferred again. same results. my friend had arrived, went inside and they told him they did not have an order. I told my friend to forget it. I don't understand why the person who answers the phone can't take the order. I won't be calling here for take out again.

Had a decent lunch at TGI Friday's. The service was exceptional; the server's name was Frank. My friend and I each had a Lunch Pairing. I had French onion soup and Friday's shrimp. The soup was ok, just a big glop of cheese plopped in the middle of the bowl, not browned as it should have been. Very difficult to eat politely. The shrimp were very good, not greasy, and came with limp cold French fries. My friend ordered the turkey and Swiss, which also had bacon and avocado, not mentioned in the menu. My friend doesn't eat avocado. Frank nicely offered to take it back but she removed it herself. With food allergies, Friday's should list all the main ingredients in a dish. She also got limp cold fries and started her meal with a small Caesar salad. It was a pleasant meal and the restaurant was quiet and nearly empty so we weren't rushed.

I came to grab a bite to eat and a drink with my boyfriend and what a horrible experience. We waited over 10 min to be seated in an empty restaurant. After getting a table we didn't get a waitress for another 15 min and she wasn't even pleasant. Again its a slow Wednesday night.  Im not sure who is actually running this place but they honestly need to work on the customer satisfaction skills.  Unhappy at Fridays on a Wednesday

location: Town of Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY
review: It's such a shame that this Fridays is ruining the reputation for the other Fridays. I will no longer return here due to the lack of service, extreme wait time for food when it's not even busy and just plain ol unprofessionalism! My friends, my daughter and I came here last night and it wasn't busy at all. We ordered a couple of the endless apps, the jack Daniels chicken strips, fries and my daughter ordered a kids meal. Needless to say our ordered was messed up....we didn't get "endless apps" as promised because our waitress only came once to check on our table...luckily we ordered extra water or we would have died of thirst. She then messed up our bill and over charged us for many different things-she didn't know what the heck she was doing and another table complained about her as well. We waited 35 minutes to get a correct check and speak to the manager. I left fuming and swore id never step foot in there again...there's always an issue here!!!

Can you say nightmare dining!! Lordy! It appeared was going fine with the drink order, and went down hill fast. There were 7 of us, and only 5 ordered food. First, two if the orders came out, and then about a half hour went by then a 3rd order came out delivered by the manager apologizing that it was late, and he didn't even notice that 3 other peoples orders were still missing. Well another 35 minutes later and the other three orders made it to the table. Also may I add it was there 10 special on three, all you can eat apps well more like when they feel like bringing the food you may be able to eat a few plates but you may have to dine for hours to exceed what you would normally get if you just ordered one app. Then the drink debacle.... Well they bring out two drinks in one shaker, and if they hadn't added a ridiculous amount of ice it may have actually filled up two glasses, but no such luck. The first time wasn't as bad as the second time. It literally filled up one glass and a sip in the other. Now let's get to the check... I guess Florida and NY are different in the question would you like separate checks, because that as well was a ordeal, and when it eventually did happen they just decided to add a whole extra meal that no one got at our table to my bill bad mistake since I am a huge yelper. I had to once again leave the table to track down the waitress that actually occurred on three separate occasions through out the night , and ask to please remove the charge, and never did I receive a canceled charge receipt   So the entire experience of the dining portion of the evening was a nightmare joke. Thankfully for us and said Fridays we were in the company of amazing friends, and our complaints went unheard until now. This was a Monday night and it was not what I would call  busy at all. No excuse for it, and it answers the question if why they closed do many in Florida.

Went here for a quick bite and was totally surprised and pleased. Our server Jackie was outstanding.  Prompt courteous  and very helpful in helping us make our food choices. We started with pretzels and cheese sauce. Yum.  The spinach flatbreads which Jackie recommended were very tasty and had a very nice presentation .  So delicious.  The Cajun pasta was very flavorful. The sizzling sirloin over spinach was great.  The classic burger was off the hook.  Can't beat those 3 dollar long island ice teas.  Def going back

Well, it is Friday's.  It was busy but not prime dinner time, under a 5 min wait for two. Some staff seemed to be super busy while others seemed to be dancing to the music being played and not working.  Our drinks came out quickly but when the chips and salsa seemed to take a long time I decided to check yelp.  I pointed out the poor ratings on service to our server and he stated "I am not qualified to comment on behalf of the company, I will get my manager". Humm... Sounds like he had to call in the legal department. The manager came out and notes they were trying to do better.  looking at the calories, they didn't have a burger under 1100 calories. I thought that was rather silly. The 10oz sirloin was only 570.  I am not counting calories here but a burger and pie and coffee was nearly 3000 calories. I try to keep under 2500 for the day!  The entree menu is really rather limited since I was last at a TGI Fridays over 5+ years ago. I ordered the 10pz sirloin with 2 sides. baked potato, and creamed spinach.  Out of baked potatos??  But they had mashed.  Humm.. Asked for creamed spinach  without the mushrooms the waiter notes were in them. The shrooms can't be removed.  OK, now I got it.  Their food is "flash frozen" and just reheated.  I asked if the mashed potatoes were fresh or a mix.  He went and pulled his manager over again.  I asked how is it you are out of baked potatoes but have mashed ? And are they real?  he advised they receive the potatos and the mashed potatoes flash frozen, but they are "real". The sirloin was not quite "restaurant grade".  The industry generally gets the best cuts of beef before consumers.  If you were not aware, you are now.  This was a bit tough and more consumer grade.  It was OK. But to be honest, for $23 for the entree I can pay another $7 and get a better sirloin and fresh baked potato and have my spinach without the mushrooms because it is made fresh not flash frozen much in the same way as "first class" airline food.  Great for first class airline food, but this is a restaurant. I gave it 3 stars because I suspect there is a need for a chain that you know what you are getting.  It will be rather consistent based on its manufacturing process, as opposed to "cook".  it wasn't great and it wasn't awful. It was good for that "mass consumption" style chain.  $55 for two of same entrees and a blue moon draft x 2.  OK.  Fresh in most places would have been $75-80. But I know some nice "hidden treasures" where you can get fresh for that price.  They are not as easy to find, nor as common as a TGI Fridays is. So TGI Fridays serves its purpose.  It is good for what it is.

I'm going to make this quick cause...well...it's Friday's. We're not talking about a gourmet meal here people. What we want is our hot food to be hot and our drinks to be cold and refilled often.  I consider myself a foodie but not a food snob if that makes sense. Friday's food at the Levittown location is as it should ....relatively priced, fresh, typical. I have zero complaints with anything I've ever ordered at this location. So why the 3 stars instead of 5??? The service. The management at this location is seriously lacking. Waiters and waitresses almost always are moving in slow motion and the food itself just takes FOREVER to come out. Which is truly a shame because most of the staff happen to be very polite and professional. I have had on two separate occasions had a waitress give me chips or bread to munch on because my food (we're talking a salad or sandwich not a friggin rack of lamb) has taken almost 30 to 45 minutes to come out.  I think going to a place like this, you have certain and reasonable expectations. Not having to wait a half hour for a salad should be one of them. And I should probably mention that I work nights, so all the times I have been here have been during the day when the place has very few customers. An easy fix I hope they work on!

Ate here, 3 hours later I am throwing up.  I haven't puked from eating since I was a little kid.  This place is so dirty I shouldn't have tried the food.  Walk in and look at the filthy floors, seats, and tables... Then do yourself a favor and walk back out to find a cleaner place to eat.  Thanks for the vomiting experience... I won't be back.

This is a typical Friday's only it seems a bit smaller. I don't try to go to this place on Friday or the weekends because the wait is always very long. The parking lot of always congested and it seems the spaces are very narrow. They share a parking lot with Old Navy.  The menu changes frequently and they have a good kids menu if you have any kids. There is also a bar.  The food is pretty good. The same as any other Friday's.

I love that I have a Friday's at the end of my street! This place tend to be a little slow even when it's not busy! As like any other Friday's the jack Daniels sauce goes great with anything, I love the pretzels too!! The bar is great and the are very accommodating with young children!

Waited a while before hostess came over to greet us and from there things just got worse and worse...waited forever for my frozen margarita which was warm froth when it finally arrived.. Salad ordered as entree came first then waited 20 min for spinach dip to come which lacked taste and warmth.. 15 min entrees arrived got chicken fingers instead of Chxn sandwich and carrots for side came frozen and without ranch dip...place is a total disaster
Terrible service, awful management. Waiters and waitresses seem like they just started working here. The bartenders have an attitude. Go somewhere else. Like Chili's down the road.

Hit or miss here. We love the food but sometimes the staff is very lackluster others, great. Every so often we have to send a dish back as the cooks don't seem to understand how to cook beef to medium.

absolutely horrible! first off I hate chain restaurants. There's nothing fresh about fridays at all. But the reason I'm giving such a harsh review is because the last time i was dragged to go here, my aunt's broccoli came in a plastic streamer bag!!! they totally forgot to take it out and it was literally served to her in plastic! ew! everything is frozen. you couldn't drag me back if you tried.

We were a party of 9 on a weekend night so I understand the 45 min wait. The initial waitress was really nice but definitely could not handle the workload without lots of help. It took a while for us to get our drinks and order extra appetizers and even refills on water. We had to always search and ask for things. They needed more help or more multitasking. Some of the dishes and drinks came out wrong. For example, I wanted broccoli instead of potatoes and the server said he would bring them out. They never came until I told the waitress they never came. They also didn't mention the Fridays want more stripes card at any of the Fridays I've been eating at! Our bill was over $600 and they should have payed extra attention to us. Just because a restaurant is busy should not mean bad service and long waits.  Fridays should be aware and equipped for that!  Overall though it was fun and good and dessert was a delicious mudslide!

This is a smaller Friday's but it wasn't very busy when I had lunch there last Sunday.  My friend and I stopped in for the Dine & Drink $10 promo.  She had the bruschetta shrimp pasta, which was a huge portion.  I had the sizzling citrus herb chicken, which was a much less substantial meal and came with a sad excuse for caprese salad (about 1/2 cup of grape tomatoes and exactly two small balls of mozzarella, halved).  The chicken breast was flavorful but very salty.  We both had the light blackberry margarita which tasted like frozen crystal light and didn't seem to have any alcohol in it at all.  I believe this meal was under 550 calories--because I was still hungry when we left the restaurant.

Stopped here for a late night snack , our server was Rebecca was our server extremely slow. We had to have a host hunter her down for refills. we had an extra charge on our account under open, which she failed to explain there was extra charge for something we ordered till we got the bill. We waited 25 minutes for the bill, she had constantly told us not to rush but barely checked on us. When we finally got the bill, the correct server name wasn't even on the bill. We're big fans of TGI Friday's but this was extremely disappointing.

I forgot that i was done with TGIF's....they micro manage everything...i got an order of (10) buffalo wings...my boyfriend got parmesean crusted chicken....he got a tiny portion of chicken, and an ice cream scoop of mashed potatoes...and for ten wings was $11.40, was salty as hell....sam winter was 7.50.....im ashamed of myself that i gave fridays another chance
haven't been here in a while .....last few times I was not happy....but decided to go for just apps and was pleasantly surprised the apps were all great and the service was good

We arrived after 9.30pm and it is not busy for a Saturday.  10:21 we were seated 15 minutes ago and still no service.   Redemption-food came out very quickly.  Cheese and broccoli soup is great. Spinach dip is good. Cheese sticks good. Pretzel sticks good.  Sangria was very good.   Overall ok but the delays in service really set a bad tone for the evening.   Waitress was very nice.
Delicious food, decent prices. Love the apps. Cesar is the best waiter, so friendly and on top of things. Their peanut butter and jelly wings are really good and I'd recommend getting them

Went there for drinks & appetizers last night and was pleased with our experience :) Good happy hour appetizers and drinks Great prices and amazing service from the Bar staff :) Very friendly staff :) would definitely return !

Wish I can give ZERO stars. You have got to be kidding me with this place! I thought I was being punked by a tv show or something. Are you freaken serious??? I came here with my husband for a night to relax being that we are workaholics and I regret it. Keep in mind we are African American in a predominantly white area/restaurant .  We sat at the bar and the bartender was practically non existent. We practically had to ask for a menu. And secondly, he wasn't attentive whatsoever! We had to yell across from where we are sitting and sometimes even flag for a couple minutes just to get him. What kind of BULLSHIT is that?!!!???!! Then he had the nerve to have us waiting 15 minutes for a dam fork to eat. He never checked up on us to see if we need anything else. What a fucken ASSHOLE!!!! He paid attention to the groups of Caucasians that were there and not us. Treated us like dogs. Ok I get it, you may not like "our kind" but you're working with the public so why apply to this job? So pathetic and sad. This dumb ass was so busy watching the game that he charged us double for our bill! Yet another wait to fix it.

Love when folks pull the race card out when they are just insufferable jerks. The place is great. I go all the time and have gone with black, asian, blue friends and never a problem. I have been served by Frank and others and always a good time. Its not the Four Seasons but the price is right the beer is cold and the food is good and cheap. Try the spinach flatbread or the garlic parm wings.
Drinks at the bar are surprisingly good. However the food is mediocre and service is hit and miss. Worth a trip if you go for happy hour

Our server acted like she was annoyed when we simply asked for separate checks. The food was good. Honestly this isn't the best Friday's on Long Island because during my recent visits here I've had waiters that didn't have great attitudes. I don't think I'll be coming back soon.

I like this Fridays for the burgers and appetizers.  The burgers are really good.  I think the new double burgers are too greasy though.  The string bean fries are great as well as the flat breads and potstickers.  Deserts are good too.  Can't vouch for everything else, but those items are good.  Drinks are good too, but expensive unless you stick to beer.

After getting spam with their latest promo of 4-7-4 appetizer, entree, and dessert.   I expected $4 appetizers, $7 entrees, and $4 desserts.  Nope nothing was too good to be true.  First, my experiencing wasn't great besides the deceitful advertising.  We got in and I can see there is a line forming on a Friday evening.  I was told a 30 minute wait. So, I went to the bar trying to get a drink before my table was ready.   Waiting to get the bartender's attention and lost count of the minutes waiting..I get a call from my wife my table was ready.  I got to the table she already got her Ice Tea before I even got my beer.  That is a problem.  The bar was either under staff or slow as snails.   Finally, I got to my table and saw what was offered on the 474 menu.  I was like this is going to suck.  They had maybe 1 or 2 of the items at the price and the rest were  at higher prices.  One would expect at higher price you would get a little more food.  I didn't know the 474 menu was a extension of the kids menu and it felt like it when my wings and pasta came out.  I left hungry and vow never to return for another several years ( the last time I visited TGIF).   The memory was so bad it was like a bad trip that keeps on going.

Amazing service at the bar!!!!! Every time my husband and I go, we sit at the bar. The staff is phenomenal!!!! Tristan and Gary are absolutely delightful, and the service is so fast. Definitely the best Friday's around!!!!

I arrived at 12:05 pm, Friday, for a quick lunch.  I have been trying to change my eating habits so, I didn't want a dish with a lot of food. Their 474 menu fit my needs!  They have four (4) dollar appetizers, seven (7) dollar entrees, and four (4) dollar desserts.  These are smaller portions but, filling for me.  I opted out for an app, went straight to the chicken bruschetta pasta and the brownie obsession for dessert. My server, Lauren, was top notched.  She was waiting on three other tables but, I wasn't bothered by the short wait for my food.  After she served me my drink, she was hustling getting everyone served! I enjoyed the meal, although the temperature of my pasta was warm.  I would have preferred it a bit hotter.  The brownie was soo good!!  My one cheat dessert for the week.   Great service and satisfying food.  I was pleased.  I will stop in again.

Wish I could give zero stars Came here since it was just super close to movie theater didn't really expect much. Food was mediocre like super mediocre I didn't even touch my food I just cut it up to tiny pieces and eh it just had no flavor tasted like I was eating rubber. My sever was trying to rush everyone out. It was really ridiculous. I feel like if you barely come to check on us then don't try rushing us out.

The first time I went there I was angry and not health conscientious. The food was good and the staff is friendly.  The second time I went there, I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to find anything to meet my health needs. As it turned out, they have updated their menu and they do have some satisfying healthy options. I had the bourbon grilled mahi mahi with my choice of two sides: broccoli and mozz-tom salad. I'd definitely go back and try some of their other healthy eats too.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the water service is bad. And the fact that our waitress visits us like she's on a moving train without stops. It was hard to get a hold of her and request additional items as desired. For her it was as if her boss told her go onto the next one as soon as she reached the table she was aiming for, and then again when she got to that one, etc. Also our table wasn't entirely clean when we sat down. I had to brush off someone else's leftovers prior to sitting.  Other than that, happy (un)healthy eats!

Oh My goodness the noise level in this Friday's is so bad you cannot hear your self think let alone enjoy eating or speaking to your dining partner its impossible. But, how about this, the waiters and bartenders can't hear you at all or each other! Only two tables and four bar stools occupied in the bar area, One table full of noisy children running around and screaming. I think it might be the acoustics they should look into it.  With so few people in the bar It still took us 20 minutes to get the bartenders attention. She was very friendly once she decided to come over however after giving us an incorrect order she became belligerent and testy. I pointed out that maybe the noise level caused the confusion and instead of changing our drinks order she rolled her eyes and walked away. Whoa. Never had an experience like this in a Fridays before so needless to say even though it is the closest one to my home I will not be returning. Ever. I advise you to go the extra mile to the one in Westbury where you get excellent attention, have a great manager and really chill staff

Dear Mr. or Mrs. Fridays, I hope this message finds you well. My name is Steve and I have been a long-time patron of your Levittown, NY location. And when I say "long-time" I'm not referring to the number of years since my first visit to your restaurant, but rather the amount of time I have spent recently in this establishment.  I'm no stranger to TGI Fridays. I grew up in suburban Long Island, in the shadow of your original 63rd street and 1st Ave Manhattan location. Although my local Friday's was always your illustrious Westbury restaurant, I'm happy to say that I have sampled many of your locations throughout the continental United States and abroad. I've been to Friday's as diverse as the Fort Lauderdale Airport, all the way to the TGI Friday's Dundrum, at the Dundrum shopping center in Dublin, Ireland. Clearly, I'm no stranger to your delightfully tasty microwaved food, middle-of-the-road service, or moderately priced alcohol.  However, it has recently come to my attention that your Levittown, NY location is not living up to the run-of-the-mill standards Friday's has become tolerated for. In fact, if I may say so, every experience I have had at this location has been poor to unbearable. Allow me to explain. Although I would never actively go out of my way to visit any of your restaurants, your Levittown location happens to be situated within walking distance of one of the finest movie theaters I have ever visited. The AMC Levittown not only features reclining seats, but also offers pre-assigned seating. Why is this important you ask? Because simply, I no longer have to worry about getting to the movies early in order to secure a seat. But what has this got to do with Friday's? In a word, everything. By giving me extra time to arrive at the theater, AMC Levittown has opened for me what I like to call the "buzzed window". This is the brief amount of time I have to consume enough alcohol to make the first two-acts of any movie bearable. Realistically speaking, this buzz can only last two acts, as by act three I will likely be sober and annoyed, or asleep. I assure you, those recliners are comfortable beyond belief. Even if the movie is terrible, I still feel like I get my moneys worth.  However, the problem is that the only bar near enough to the theater is your TGI Friday's. Unfortunately, the service at this location is horrendous. Your bartenders consistently ignore patrons when they arrive, take forever to deliver orders, and in many cases are down right rude. Just this evening, I had my good friend time our transaction. It took 4 minutes before a bartender even greated us, and another 3 and a half minutes to get 2 simple beers. This falls far below even the mediocre standard established by your other restaurants.  I've worked in the restaurant and hospitality industry for ten years. Although I'm no expert in TGI Friday's, I like to think I know a thing or two. I've danced with a three-for-all on several occasions. I've stared down an ultimate margarita in the face without flinching. And I've got enough Jack Daniels sauce in deep freeze to keep me knee deep in flat-iron steaks and baby-back ribs through the zombie apocalypse. But your Levittown location makes me wonder if my preparations for the fall of society  would have been better at the Applebees take out window. Normally, I give restaurants a pass. However, the Friday's of Levittown has let me down in almost every way. No matter if it's a bustling Saturday night, or a Wednesday afternoon when I'm the only customer there. They fail every time.  After finally speaking up and saying something tonight, the manager gave me a business card for a free entrée. I'd considering going back to use it, but I don't know when I'll have the time. Sincerely, Steve

If I could leave zero stars, I would.  I usually come here twice a month because I have a toddler niece and this is one of the only places where it's acceptable to dine with children.  The last two times we were here, the service has been beyond terrible.  If I were to go into detail, I would be here writing all day, so to keep it simple; the wait was extremely long, the food came out frozen, and took over 2 hours to come out.  This did not happen once, but twice.  The manager did credit our bill both times, but I was not looking for a credit.  I was looking for a well ran simple restaurant where I could enjoy myself with my young niece and family.   A tip for the management:  crediting customers is not the answer.  Hiring a competent staff is.

Went here with me wife for lunch. We were seated immediately and was pleased to see that the place was neat and clean.  We started with ordering the Pot Stickers. OMG they were so good. I highly recommend trying them if you never had before.  The JD baby back ribs were cooked to perfection and the Parmigiana Steak Fries were amazing. Our waitress frequented our table to see if we wanted re fills on our drinks which was awesome.  I am not into crowds, so coming here at night isn't for me. But lunch time is a different story. The staff is great and the food is delicious.

Went here yesterday for the endless apps because it quite worth the $12. They had some new beef app on the menu, forget what exactly it was called but hey it doesn't matter because they were out of them. Ordered other apps and they were cooked well. Boneless wings were terrific. Wanted another order of pot stickers but from the time I had my first order to the time I wanted the second order which was about 30 minutes they ran out of them too. Don't ask me how a place that wants you to get endless apps runs out of them. I would think they would order extra and maybe they did but they needed more extra. In any event, it's still a place we like to go. Service is good, selection is good and the prices are fine.

We come to this TGIF's because of its proximity to the movie theater and its convenient late night hours. We recently came on a Saturday evening after 10pm despite being busy we were seated in 5 minutes. The service was great, but the food was below average for a Fridays. I asked for a medium steak knowing it might get overcooked. When I received it it was more than well done, even crisp on the outside. The spinach, cheese dip was really watery instead of creamy like it usually is. The floor near the table was really sticky and gross.

I will never come back here. The potato skins were still frozen, the burger was disgusting. I could've bought a better frozen burger from the store. The bun was hard. The French onion soup was terrible. The server wasn't great either, forgetting to bring another beer and water. disgusting place to eat at.

This place is horrible!! My husband ordered a double stack burger which basically looked like a mcdonalds burger with tons of this mixed coleslaw salad garbage that was stacked on his burger. He asked for his burger medium rare but how can u cook a burger to that if its so thin?  He wenT home with hungry stomach. Good thing i had brought home a chicken roll earlier that day. My sister in law ordered some mai fish im not sure what exactly but her side dishes were bigger than the piece of fish. The fish was dry as well. Never again. What a waste. I think its time for this place to shut its doors.

Horrible from start to finish. Server was unacceptable. Right out of a crackerjack box! It may be time to hire new staff!  No knowledge of the menu items or specials or happy hour deals.  Ordered my burger medium came char-burnt couldn't return it or say anything cause no one came over.  No manager in sight- where is the manger?!?? You get what you pay for- money wasted!

The food used to be reliable, but I don't know what happened. I used to order the chicken Caesar salad, which was always good. The last time, they had changed it. Less chicken, and some weird frilly leaves mixed in that were definitely not Romaine. The burgers used to be good, and hand made. The last time my son and I got them, they were the thin, pre-made, frozen kind. Not good at all. My son used to get a decent Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp, but the last time it was disgusting. The portion sizes are smaller, too. Despite all the points and coupons I have for this place, I won't be going back.

While TGI Fridays has fallen from grace over the past years there are still some treasures to be found on their menu. First and foremost are the pan seared pot stickers. Chewy like bubble gum on the outside and pork product flavoring inside make for quite a pair when dipped in szechwan sauce. This trio delivers an abundance of flavor. Hibachi Skewers are another favorite of mine. So much flavor happening at once with the ginger lime slaw interacting with the garlic and black pepper soy sauce. While I think the Jack Daniels line is very hip and trendy, I see it nothing more than a gimmick. I also think the shrimp are frozen, but that's just my opinion. There are specials for drinks if that helps.

Usually TGIF isn't my first choice to go to. After today all my views on Fridays has vanished our server Julia was amazing! She was really patient while dealing with three tables of 6+ people. She frequently checked on how we were doing with drinks and food which I really appreciated. I will definitely be coming back to this Friday's.
Waitress was great and accommodating but the food wasn't what I thought it would be, had a sampler and me and my gf were sick the next day

My co-worker and I dined here last week and the place was really awesome. Very clean and the staff was really warm and welcoming! Our food came out in the knick of time and our waiter was very attentive to us. Definitely one of the best TGIFs on Long Island.

For starters I would like to say that our waitress, Maelinda, was a delight. The evening started off very well and we ordered our drinks and appetizers came out accordingly. I was with 3 other people. 3/4 of us got burgers and the 1/4 got a steak. The 3 of us who ordered the burgers got them and began eating. Before we knew it we were all done with our meal and the steak never came out. Maelinda asked how everything was and my boyfriend had explained that he never received his meal. She was sincerely apologetic and handled the situation by telling a manager. Usually a manager is supposed to apologize for any mistakes that has been made. Nope, not this branches manager. She BLAMED my boyfriend for not alerting anyone that he didn't receive his meal. He kindly told her that no one came by nor stayed long enough for him to get their attention. She then told him he should've told a hostess. I'm sorry, but I will no longer spend my money at an establishment who blames the customers for not handling the situation.

Hm, it's Friday's. Typical American chain restaurant. Apps, burgers, steak, seafood, salads, soup, drinks, dessert. Something for everyone.  Tonight service was decent. Our waiter, Steven was good and on point with everything...drinks and food. Everything was brought out in a reasonable amount of time.  I ordered the Cobb salad with siracha shrimp. It was very good, and came with a good amount of shrimp. I also had a blue moon that was nice and cold..just the way I like it! Salad and beer? Of course! It's all about balance!  My mom ordered the the all American stacked burger. It had lettuce, tomato, cheese and applewood bacon. She rated it an 8/10. With the stacked burgers you can't say how you want it cooked because the burgers are very thin.  My stepdad ordered a turkey burger with avocado and sweet potato fries. He enjoyed his turkey burger, but said the sweet potato fries were a little salty.

I mean...It's Friday's. If you're coming here expecting a Michellin star dining experience, look elsewhere. If you're coming here to split apps and drink beer then you'll be okay.  The wait is almost always long. The bar area is the place to sit. The wait is usually less for that area and there are TVs to keep you entertained. The beer list is what any typical chain restaurant offers but still something to please everyone. The staff here is super friendly and they never rush you. They also use iPads now to pay your bill. The appetizer deal of 3, 4, or 5 choices with wings is the way to go. I never eat entrees here. But if I want a snack with a large glass of beer then I come here and indulge.

I ordered online my order was supposed to be ready by 7:55pm, it is currently 8:18 and I am still waiting. Unacceptable I have to be some where I thought online ordering service was supposed to be quick and efficient.

So disappointed tonight. Yes its Fridays, I'm not looking for tablecloth dining, a late night snack with my teenager after a long day for the both of us.  Seated in a few minutes, great! order drinks and apps, one of the apps were cold, but we couldn't find the server, or any one to call attention to this. no one followed up when the drinks and apps were served. Had to get up and walk to the front of house. second course delivered, I guess now the server was annoyed, as she dropped the entrees and never asked if we needed anything...hello, we need silver ware, none on the table, we don't usually eat with our hands. empty glasses, and no question if we would like another drink or anything else to drink. we called over another employee and pointed out that the first glass was dirty, for which he apologized for. We also had to ask this other employee for silver ware to eat with, and also for another drink. Second drink came, and the glass had lipstick marks all over it. I am sorry 2 glasses both dirty. no follow up by server. I'm done. when we asked for the check, we got just that, the check. all dishes left sitting on the table. Do we know what bussing means? I have visited this establishment many times. Tonight was unfortunately "your biggest night mare". Oh, by the way, do you know when serving food and drinks your long hair should be tied up?

the service was very good! The waitress was very friendly and attentive to everyone at our table! my only gripe was that this is the second time I have tried to order a blue moon draught beer at this location and they did not have it in stock! overall excellent service!

Friday's is a typical chain restaurant. Came here on a Saturday night around 8pm and waited 20 minutes for a table. The table ordered Jack Daniel's Ribs, Jack Daniel's skirt steak and the California Chicken Sandwich. It took about 35 minutes for the food to come out. The bus boy had stated that the sides of spinach would be right out, but yet, we had to ask the waitress to bring it out after 10 minutes. The ribs were quite delicious. The skirt steak was very fatty and did not have the Jack Daniel's sauce on it, which led us to believe that we were given the wrong steak. The manager, Marissa, came over and said she would take the steak off the bill. I ordered the California chicken sandwich which was suppose to come with a aioli sauce, but it didn't taste like any sauce was on the sandwich. Overall, it was still good. I have had better experiences at Fridays and am hoping that this visit was just a fluke.

Went to order Friday's to go on a Friday night. The restaurant is not set up well for to go orders - you have to wait by the bar where servers are walking back and forth by the kitchen and there is nowhere to stand. When we arrived at the restaurant, they told us they thought we cancelled our order because apparently someone else placed an order under the same name and decided to cancel and the staff confused the two orders (oddly enough my credit card was still charged). Had to wait an additional 15 minutes at the restaurant while they prepared our order. The staff did not seem sympathetic or responsive to my needs and I felt like they just wanted to get us out the door. Even the manager didn't seem to care about the situation. The worst, however, was that after writing a complaint on their website, we were never contacted by anyone in customer service and I felt like we were completely ignored. Of all the places I have gotten food from, the customer service from Friday's is the worst. Their menu is also very lacking in any healthier options for people trying to eat lighter. I would advise anyone to stay away from here.

I sat at the bar, my bartender and server's name was Nyzsha. She's very sweet and attentive.  I first ordered the frozen lava flow. It tasted like there was no alcohol in it. I put in my appetizer and main course before her friends arrived but they were served first. Not sure if it was the meal or the perks of knowing who works there.   I then ordered the BFM Marg.  It tasted much better than the first drink. My main course came but not my appetizer. I was a bit confused. She claimed she "forgot"..   I ordered my steak medium rare and it was well done.  I'm not sure what happened to this place. I came here a few years back and the service and food was great.. now it's a horror coming in to eat. Maybe she was new. After she gave me the check she didn't even come back to see when I was ready to pay.  The manager came and was very nice to complete my order. I guess they saw the look on my face and decided to give me a lunch punch card. If I'm not coming back I'm not sure what the incentive is but lol Overall my experience was terrible.

Go to Chili's instead. It looked like this place gave us someone else's half eaten dip order. The rest of the food just didn't taste good. Low quality. Eating there might be slightly better than the take out, but I don't know.

While out shopping today, this Friday's was in the shopping center so it was an easy choice to go. It was around 5pm that we walked in. Not very crowded at all for a late Sunday afternoon.  The hostess asked us if it would be ok if she sat us at one of the high top tables by the bar.  There were enough regular tables available but whatever, we sat where she sat us.  After a few minutes the waiter comes over to take our drink order.  We keep it simple....glass of wine and a beer. I put my appetizer order in for wings. Drinks come and we order our main course.  We each order one of the steak  choices, one cooked medium the other medium well.   Broccoli was one of the sides that was offered with the dish but they were out of broccoli so we had to mix and match side dishes. We also ordered a tomato basil soup. The wings came and they were very good, so food wise I thought we were off to a good start.  The main dishes came out in a fair amount of time.  A few bites into each steak, we noticed that instead of cooked medium and medium well, they were both barely medium...maybe even closer to rare. We were tempted to ask the waiter to take them back to cook to order, but he was busy correcting an error on the bill for the people next to us..... and also being hungry we didn't want to wait any longer.   We had some steak left over so we asked for it to be wrapped to go..at that point we realized we never got the soup we ordered. When the waiter came over to take our leftovers to be wrapped, he informed us the soup had been accidentally served to a different table. At that point we were done eating so told him just take it off the bill.    He took the leftovers and gave us the check, which I paid by credit card. He rang it up and brought it back to be signed, so we signed and left.  It wasn't until we were on the road that I realized he never brought back our leftovers.  This place seems unorganized.  From seating to service to how meals are cooked. I wasn't expecting a 5 star steakhouse, but I wasn't expecting I'd be writing a 1 star review either.  There are plenty of other chain restaurants on this strip of Hempstead Tpke.  Next time this one will not be a choice.
I came in with a group of special needs young adults. We waited over and hour and half for our food. I would NOT recommend for special needs groups.
So bad. The food and drinks took so long. My dish was wrong. Low quality. I know it's a chain but come on. I won't go to any Fridays ever again.

The price are to high, their food really isn't that great. And their TV set up really really sucks. If u want to watch something at the bar ,it changes all the 7 Tv's. They want to be a sports type of bar, but the are no where near it.
Service was terrible , never entered my name for reservation, got both my food orders wrong and kept bringing my food to the wrong table

I actually went in with a few friends today after seeing War for the Planet of the Apes and I gotta say, this place was pretty good! We got seated really quickly with a super sweet waitress who came by a lot to check on us and give us refills, napkins etc. One of us got the chicken quesadillas while me and the others ordered the Buffalo Wingsman Burger. HOOOOLY CRAP WAS IT AMAZING! It's a sizzling patty served with the usual lettuce, tomato, onions and pickles. BUT THEN, there's the adding of the cheese blends and special spicy sauce mixtures and hot pickle bits. And to top it all off, two blazing buffalo wings placed on top of the bun with a toothpick to hold this monster sized burger all together! That with fries and a drink is ONLY $12.99!!! That's a pretty sweet deal indeed! It'll take awhile to get your food if you order appetizers no matter the size, but over all if you and a group of friends want a place to sit down, laugh and have a pretty delicious meal, then look no further!

We went for the new endless apps deal. In the old promotion they gave you full size apps. This time they are only half size. They also use the same ingredients in many so they basically taste the same. For example the quesadilla shows 4 pieces in the picture but you only get 2. The flat bread Pizza tastes practically the same with that shredded barbecue chicken and similar crust. So you get half orders and they take 20 minutes to come out. You waste a lot of time and the food was just acceptable.

had seen quite a few bad reviews for this location so just wanted to say the food is typical fare, what you would expect, it came quickly and was served hot, the staff was attentive and friendly, our server Alex was wonderful, the a c was working and had a decent time

I wanted to try out Uber Eats. I decided that TGI Friday's was going to be the first restaurant I experimented with. I had NO issues with the delivery as my driver was pleasant and timely however the food order was sub par.  The potato skins were an overly salted potato cut in half with a slab of ripped American cheese slapped on it with a sprinkle of bacon. The cheese was BARLEY melted. We also got a side of the tomato mozzarella salad and the portion of cheese to tomatoes was minimal- also SO much dressing it was overwhelming. I got the jack daniels chicken sandwich which was OKAY at best. It was very difficult to eat and somewhat dry. My boyfriend got the buffalo wingmans burger and requested an egg to be added. When it came it was also a complete mess and the egg (which one would assume to be fried on top of the burger, was a chopped up, dry hard boiled egg in a plastic container).  It MIGHT have been better at the restaurant but at this point I was so disappointed I don't want to find out.
Went there today! Before taking my son to the movies! Very quick! Would definitely recommend! My son got the kid sliders and I had the jack Daniels ribs! Pretty good

I don't know if management has changed here, but the service has become absolutely HORRIBLE, the orders are never right and everything takes forever to come out. A week ago their systems went down while we were in the middle of ordering, and the food took at least an hour to come out, then it was wrong then they told us they could only accept cash. My husband had to leave the restaurant, get cash, and come back to pay and after all that they a manager never came to our table, no one offered to give us money off the check or offered us anything for the inconvenience. We decided to give I t a second chance, and eat again I am sitting here waiting over 30 minutes for my appetizer to come out,  while the manager is blatantly standing in the bar watching football with the patrons. Sadly, We will not be coming back here again to waste our time or money.

I drove all the way here from queens to enjoy a paint night and dinner with my mother... the manger said paint night was canceled but there was no cancellation on the  website. when I asked for a manger she was not very helpful and was rude about the whole situation. I truly don't understand how she can say it has nothing to do with Friday's if the room they use for paint night is in Friday's restaurant. We than sat for dinner The food & waiter was good, but when I went to use the bathroom the Manger gave me a nasty look. Very unhappy with her unpleasant management skills. She made me feel very uncountable in this environment therefore I will not be eating here again. Good food and wait staff but if you have a issue get ready for a unprofessional & rude manger.

Where to begin...we were told we were getting a high top in the bar. We got a low top next to a door. The door was clearly labeled "Please use front door" yet drunks were going in and out. Management said nothing as we got an unrelenting breeze. Food portions were extremely small. My husbands margarita had no alcohol and was full of ice. When he asked for a second it was forgotten. However, the kicker was the baby with the drunk parents sitting at the bar. This was quite possibly the worst dining experience I've had in a while and we won't be back.
Came for lunch and had the best Barbados Rum Punch.  The bartender knows her wines and drinks and is over the top with service.

Went there to watch some football and we met Richard who was our server in the bar area. Hands down what a gem!! Awesome person and employee, now when I go back I'll look for him. He was always spot on with our food and making sure we were ok and needed anything else. Thank you Richard

Sat at the bar today for lunch great bartender very friendly and attentive we talked about our pets who won't let you sleep lol I got a bacon cheeseburger medium and it was actually medium usually that never happens. Fries a bit salty but eatable extra ketchup with mayo cut that down.

Came to fridays on a Sunday night for a Quick bite to eat before John and I saw a movie at Levitown AMC.We sat down at the table when we realized we probably should've sat at the bar and ordered food because it's five dollar apps at the bar but anyways  we got an order of mozzarella sticks which were soggy and bad Plus I don't know what was up with that marinara sauce but it looks like it's sad out for a week and then they gave it to us.  we got an order of pretzels with cheese, not good Pretzels were burnt cheese tasted like shit  we got endless hot wings that were not good... dry& gross  And Asian wings that were The best thing we had all night.. good sauce.  The service was not that good. It took a long time for the waitress to come over and greet us, it took a long time to get water, it took a long time to order our meal. When you are on a short timeline because you have to catch a movie it's quite stressful having to wait the entire time for every little thing. Walking out we saw a manager yelling at a busboy... this place kind of just sucked honestly. I will not be going back, ever. If I need a meal before the movies I'll go to chipotle.

I went to this restaurant on the evening of November 17th and received the WORST SERVICE EVER ! The waiting area only have three women- waiting for a table, and it didn't seem busy. My  date had asked the hostess, to see the bar area- and it was crowded. So then ,he asked if we could be seated at a booth. The blonde hostess asked for his name, and told him -the wait time is 10 minutes. So we sat down , and waited to be called. We noticed that people were entering the restaurant , checked in with the hostess and was seated within two- three minutes. After ten minutes were up , I checked back with the hostess to see if there was a booth table available. She said , 10 minutes. So I waited. More people came in and was seated - right away. I check back in , and the hostess asks for my name. I gave my dates name , and she never typed it into the tablet. So annoyed with the incompetent Hostess - we left and  went to Miller Ale's. The good and atmosphere there was 100 times better ! The Miller Ale's House Hostess greeted us , and the Staff was very welcoming ! I'm NEVER STEPPING INTO THIS JOKE OF A RESTAURANT AGAIN .

I have to say that I am very disappointed with my visit here at TGIF's. The overall experience has tainted my view on this chain forever. It all started off with the poor attitude of the host, taking over five minutes trying to find a table of four a spot. I could've walked in blindfolded and found a quicker table. When we finally found a spot, our waitress took over 10 minutes to even say hi. Even when she approached us, she tried being cool dropping the f bomb and lingo like brb. It was very unprofessional.  Megan took our order, and what we wanted to eat but it was practically a drought at our table. The food almost came quicker than our drinks. When we did eat, and needed refills, she failed to realize this and "acted apologetic" when she "noticed." I even had to go to the bar, to get a refill, because she prioritized cleaning a table void of customers, rather than getting a refill. At the end, Meg even messed up our cards, charging more money to my friend, rather then my card. As Meg put it. "I'm a complete f***ing disaster."The food was what you would expect, but the fact that TGIF now has unlimited apps for $15 is a rip off. I would suggest hiring more professional employees that can do there job

It's been over a week since I had an issue with the to go order.  I was told that the GM and corporate would be reaching out to me.  Obviously, that was a lie told to me.   told 20 minutes wait, food not ready 40 minutes later, rude employees, food still not ready at hour mark, missing sides, and food was cold. I'm so glad I'm a rewards member.

Where do i start !!! My husband and i enter the resturant at approx 4:10pm there were two couples ahead of us waiting for a table We asked for a booth and was told it would be a wait. We waited approx 10 min for our booth with approx 6 booths avaiable at the time all of which needed to be bused not one person took initiative to bus the tables to seat the waiting customers finally a worker came with a shopping bag and cleaned the tables into the bag.... we get seated and wait 15 min for our waitress to come over to our table to take our drink order/apps (i watched other people be seated after us and have there orders taken before us by this waitress) we place our dinner order i ordered bourbon chicken and my husband ordered the mac and cheese burger medium rare we recieve our apps all which were delish and now come our entrees his burger was not cooked to medium rare it was more rare but we dealt with it not that we couldve complained even if we wanted to because not once during apps or entrees did our waitress come and check on us ... she came and cleared or plates where I asked for my food to be wrapped she took my plate then came back with the check never brining back my food wrapped up back to us this is when she asked if we wanted another drink seeing my empty ice tea glass no i dont want another drink now it would have been nice while i was eating my meal not when paying the bill. we paid our bill 71.04 and let never recieving my more then half not eaten meal .... im extremly disappointed in this fridays and definitely will not be back... im not one to complain but customer service is so important especially with so many competing restaurants.. i will take my business elsewhere

I Had a disappointing experience at this location this evening.  I ordered a well done burger, which arrived not only late, but medium and pinkish.  I then reordered the burger and waited another 45 minutes.  When my fiancé requested to speak to the manager the waiter indicated that (Beth) refused to come to our table.  This was totally unprofessional for a manager not to address a-customer's concern regarding the restaurant she should be managing and ensuring that customers are being taking care of.
